pullRequest.title: Allow SDK_FILENAME to be configured via variable file
pullRequest.bodyText:
Give the option to allow SDK_FILENAME to be configurable
via the defaults.yml or any vendor variable file. Set it
based on BUILD_IDENTIFIER and fallback to 'default'.
Default to the existing definition for OpenJ9. Move the sdk
variables setup into the Archive SDK function. We don't
need it set earlier and this allows FULL_SDK_VERSION
to be set from the OpenJDK source tag. Also allow variables
to be used in the SDK_FILENAME template. The Groovy template
engine is used to resolve the variables defined in the yml.
[skip ci]
Signed-off-by: Adam Brousseau adam.brousseau88@gmail.com

nodes.bodyText:
Command could be simplified by using sed:
sed -n -e 's/+/_/g; s/^OPENJDK_TAG := //p' < closed/openjdk-tag.gmk
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -618,7 +618,25 @@ def set_build_variables() {
 def set_sdk_variables() {
     DATESTAMP = get_date()
     SDK_FILE_EXT = SPEC.contains('zos') ? '.pax' : '.tar.gz'
-    SDK_FILENAME =  "OpenJ9-JDK${SDK_VERSION}-${SPEC}-${DATESTAMP}${SDK_FILE_EXT}"
+    // Get full version from tag (eg. 11.0.8+10) and replace + with _
+    FULL_SDK_VERSION = sh (
+        script: """grep OPENJDK_TAG closed/openjdk-tag.gmk | awk 'BEGIN {FS = "[ :=]+"} {gsub(/\\+/, "_")} {print \$2}'""",

beforeCommit.message:
[skip ci] set sdk_filename based on build identifier

Signed-off-by: Adam Brousseau <adam.brousseau88@gmail.com>

afterCommit.message:
Allow SDK_FILENAME to be configured via variable file

Give the option to allow SDK_FILENAME to be configurable
via the defaults.yml or any vendor variable file. Set it
based on BUILD_IDENTIFIER and fallback to 'default'.
Default to the existing definition for OpenJ9. Move the sdk
variables setup into the Archive SDK function. We don't
need it set earlier and this allows FULL_SDK_VERSION
to be set from the OpenJDK source tag. Also allow variables
to be used in the SDK_FILENAME template. The Groovy template
engine is used to resolve the variables defined in the yml.

[skip ci]

Signed-off-by: Adam Brousseau <adam.brousseau88@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText:
Is this call required here?
The variables should be already set since set_sdk_variables() is called in build_all()  at L572 https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/blob/d13c92cbeac1fba2f26b95c6940974cea06515f9/buildenv/jenkins/common/build.groovy#L572
and archive_sdk is called after at L574
https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/blob/d13c92cbeac1fba2f26b95c6940974cea06515f9/buildenv/jenkins/common/build.groovy#L574

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -618,7 +618,26 @@ def set_build_variables() {
 def set_sdk_variables() {
     DATESTAMP = get_date()
     SDK_FILE_EXT = SPEC.contains('zos') ? '.pax' : '.tar.gz'
-    SDK_FILENAME =  "OpenJ9-JDK${SDK_VERSION}-${SPEC}-${DATESTAMP}${SDK_FILE_EXT}"
+    // Get full version from tag (eg. 11.0.8+10) and replace + with _
+    FULL_SDK_VERSION = sh (
+        script: "sed -n -e 's/+/_/g; s/^OPENJDK_TAG := //p' < closed/openjdk-tag.gmk",
+        returnStdout: true
+    ).trim()
+    echo "FULL_SDK_VERSION:'${FULL_SDK_VERSION}'"
+
+    // Use template from variable file if provided otherwise default
+    SDK_FILENAME = get_value(VARIABLES.misc.sdk_filename_template, BUILD_IDENTIFIER) ?: get_value(VARIABLES.misc.sdk_filename_template, 'default')
+    echo "SDK_FILENAME_TEMPLATE:'${SDK_FILENAME}'"
